text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Kuwait Crown Prince and Prime Minister Sheikh Saad al- Abdulla al-Sabah visits Qatar Emir Sheikh Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani in London. Sheikh Saad flew to Britain in March following colon surgery in Kuwait.

- A number of Kuwaiti MPs are pressing for a ban on satellite dishes and have urged the government to operate a cable television project in bid to "clean satellite transmission", an Islamist parliamentarian said.

- Islamist MPs on Tuesday praised the positive outcome of an investigation probing allegations that the Zakat (Alms) House used its charity money to fund certain candidates in the 1991 parliamentary elections.

- Egypt is considering a request to allow the eldest son of Iraqi President Saddam Hussein to receive medical treatment in Cairo. Uday Hussein was seriously wounded in an assassination attempt in Baghdad in December.
- Kuwait Stock Exchange index drops three points on Tuesday to 2422.1 points.
- Cairo to host in August an exhibition for Gulf Arab goods and services.
- Kuwait wins three medals at Pan Arab Games in Lebanon.

- Kuwait asks the United Nations Security Council to pressure former occupier Iraq to stop repeated border attacks. Earlier this month the two sides were involved in a shooting incident along the border.
- Second Internet cafe to open in Kuwait.
